page.title: 15THE HANGERS
page.content: The Hangers add a particular character to the area,being visually interesting and rich biologically.They are broad- leaved woodlands on steep slopes.Trees are mainly beech-some ash,oak,white- beam & yew.Owned privately until 1958, the woods were sold for timber.It was so hard to get the timber out of the badly neglected woodlands that little felling or maintenance was done, so by 1960,Hants CC were persuaded to buy back the hangers (217 acres),which in 1979 were declared a Nature Reserve. The East Hants Dist.Council recently commissioned a report from consultants on the management of the area which is known to contain several orchids,foxes badgers,dragonflies & other endangered species. The survival of this lovely area - often referred to as "Little Switzerland" is thus assured,as is the future of its magnificent woodlands.
